846D96424CE6488DBE490E13C786E79A.description: HOWL: Lifelong Learner: Student works toward constant improvement and academic growth.

03324F1DC0AA4C03AEA89F653592EB24.description: HOWL: Respectful: Student follows first requests and contributes to a positive learning environment.

CC2F7DEAB2A145AB8C5698722B142DAF.description: HOWL: Responsible: Student comes to class on time and prepared, and completes class work and homework everyday.

9AC4CD771F3F42D99FAFFC23FCAF9C11.description: Analyze and explain political, social, and cultural changes in post-colonial South Africa.

A17755240B9942FAA0B699D88B75A5E4.description: Apply an understanding of post-colonial institutions and religion in the Middle East to the Iranian Revolution and modern tension in the Middle East, including the current conflict in Israel/Palestine.

E5B894FF316D46179AA1BA6DF0302637.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the causes and consequences of the Russian Revolution.

9F0887DA87F144FC988FC4B5D4A529C7.description: Analyze and explain the contributing factors, outcomes, and legacies of the French and Haitian Revolutions.

FD7FA262749143C6B3DAC1081412BEF8.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the philosophers and pivotal documents that are connected to modern revolutionary ideology and their direct impact on the French Revolution.

2CC827BC817741DEA6A8B9C2495D5847.description: Present information using effective public speaking techniques and appropriate digital media.

20C9F6FE232C4FAFA55A194F7E13B572.description: Participate effectively in a range of discussions by clearly and persuasively expressing ideas and building on the ideas of others.

7664A4AA6D4B419E859673AD3F11F55B.description: Document research: Appropriately cite research sources with parenthetical citations and a works cited page.

6B9CA6B77CC9422788DA23589C76E916.description: Conduct research: Find and synthesize valid and relevant sources from a variety of media.

ED007E2BA35D405F9758850835995241.description: Analyze the craft and structure of informational texts.

150556B410BA4304AD3A1F9F365FBA03.description: Analyze the craft and structure of literature.

38B18985397D413AACEF4FA4290A236F.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the key ideas and details in literature and informational texts.

513927262FB24D0F8AEB5C819FD02BC6.description: Learn, apply, and refine reading strategies with literary and informational texts.

D1F69657332D48B4A71D0CE83892DDFF.description: Actively read at least 5 additional grade level appropriate books from a variety of authors.

705C0D5CB26344B5A845279C4B550CE0.description: Write narratives that use effective techniques, details, and event sequences.

D858FF27DAC340E4999F24248F690B93.description: Write informative texts that effectively select, organize, and analyze content.

C3B01BF96BD94672B1A438BAD229E3DF.description: Write arguments to support claims using valid reasoning and relevant, sufficient evidence.

6E5C9FAB8E5644D3BD27BD5BCEB25344.description: Develop and strengthen writing by planning, revising, editing, and rewriting for a specific purpose and audience.

7DF5D81F03B94F8F852D7135B59C3A25.description: Demonstrate grade level appropriate writing conventions, including capitalization, spelling, punctuation, verb tense, conjugation and pronoun use.

6B2B6E6818E049DD8D6F7E4C26EB3F77.description: Acquire and use college level vocabulary words.
